data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: Super friendly service!  If you're looking for a burger, this is a great place to go - many different concoctions!  It's a quirky little place with paintings and ornaments for sale by local artists.

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Burger hunting in Michigan,....we found this place fairly easy and The Studio Grill is what one one would call a dive.  The burger I had, I can not remember the extract name, it was a 5 star.  It had at least a 10 oz handcrafted burger, fresh mushrooms, caramelized onions, two types of cheese, smoked bacon, shaved ham, and an egg on top.  

I travel the country in search of Burgers, Dogs, Soup, and Chili and I will put this Burger in my top five. Worth the trip to Kalamazoo if your in the area. Don't be fooled with Redamaks in New Buffalo, or Fat Boys in Grand Rapids,....Studio Grill has a Real Burger!

data.title: Good breakfast and friendly staff
data.text: We took our WMU student out for breakfast and enjoyed The Studio Grill. Good prices and friendly service.  The cinnamon roll pancakes were delicious and the omelette were all good. Had the raisin toast with homemade jam and it was very good. Were lucky to walk in and get a table but the service was quick so wait wouldn't be long unless it was very crowded. Will definitely go back next time in Kalamazoo!

data.title: Wonderful lunch
data.text: Loved the bbq-bacon burger. It was amazing. My kids enjoyed the all-day breakfast for lunch....and the prices were wonderful. Great food for a reasonable price!

data.title: Welcome one and all!
data.text: The clientele here is a kaleidoscope of all types....and that makes for a unique experience.  The place is small and so you will be upclose with lots of folks also enjoying the incredibly homemade (or at least it seemed so to us) breakfast cuisine.   Located in downtown Kalamazoo the dining crowd on Sunday could be from the numerous local churches,  from the uptown upscale apartments a few blocks away and from the variety of old and older houses/apartments of students and young professionals.  All the variety coupled with the good service and food makes it a place you want to return to. And we do.

data.title: Great burgers and breakfast
data.text: Excellent stuffed burgers! Many varieties and choices!  Love the Watson (burger stuffed with Chorizo).  Breakfast food also excellent!  Get the chipotle ranch to dip your fries in! The family loves this place - they are only open for bfast and lunch (til 2pm?) and its a small place, so you may have to wait - but worth it!  We have not been disappointed here yet.

data.title: Enjoyable, creative breakfasts and great hamburgers.
data.text: Always good, locally owned and creative.  Understandably, the seating  may be a a premium at peak times.

data.title: The BEST fries!
data.text: We just happened upon The Studio Grill between watching tennis at Kalamazoo College.  It was a wonderful find!  We enjoyed the burgers,the chicken sandwich and especially the French fries.  The atmosphere is friendly and even though they were very busy, we didn't have to wait very long for our food.  We'd definitely go back!

data.title: Small and busy, but delicious!
data.text: We stopped by on a week day morning at about 9:30 am. I have passed by this restaurant on Sunday mornings and the line is out the door! However, on this morning we were able to choose from two tables. We took a table close to the front to look out the window. Table in the back was close to restroom, some how not as appealing. Bear in mind the restaurant is small, so space is limited. Server was prompt and accurately took and delivered our order. We both ordered omelets, one was off the menu the other was a choose your own ingredients. We both ordered the cinnamon raisin bread with strawberry jam and were happy with our choices. Recommend for the food, but have passed this by due to wait on weekends.

data.title: Wanna Burger in Kzoo? Here it is - Stuffed and All!
data.text: Do you want a Protein Bomb? try the peanut butter burger or the stuffed cheese burger. its handmade and its right off the griddle. Parking is a bit problematic and you may drive right by it, but its worth a quick sitdown

data.title: Awesome Little Place.
data.text:
I tried this place on a Saturday morning for some breakfast. It is a little hole in the wall on the main drag through downtown. Downtown parking can be tricky depending on the day and time you go, so plan accordingly. The place is supposedly the best burgers in S.W. Michigan according to their t-shirts and such. 

The breakfast was good, and fair priced. Service was fast and friendly. It is a small place, so they focus on fast table turnaround from what I can tell. They get busy, so you need to go in at a decent time or you will be waiting. 

I ordered a Pizza Burger to go for lunch, as it looked good since all of these people were eating burgers for breakfast. It was delicious. 

The price was fair. We were in an out in no time. I would recommended it.

data.title: You have to go here!
data.text: My daughter is going to school in Kalamazoo and we needed a good breakfast place. When we travel we like to try local restaurants so we found Studio Grill and asked some locals how it was. After hearing such great personal reviews we had to visit. The food was great! I had the Italian omelet, just excellent! Had to geT a side of fluffy pancakes that did not disappoint.  My wife had the Cinnamon Roll Cakes and said they were good. Place was jam packed so lucky we got there when we did. The lunch items sounded tasty, also. Next time we will visit for lunch.

data.title: Check them out, nice variety for all meat eaters n vegetarians
data.text: Hubby had the veggie burger n fries, I had the BLT n fries they were thicker than his by choice can't remember name nicely seasoned  the food was wonderful, best BLT I've had!!!

data.title: The best stuffed burger, club sandwich, and blueberry pancakes!
data.text: First off let me tell you that you may have to wait for a seat at the counter or for a table...but the wait is worth it.  Service is very prompt and friendly.  Nice environment with a lot of local paintings hanging on the walls. My first time in I had the Old Classic burger I had was stuffed with cheese and topped with sauteed mushrooms and served with a really tasty bun...very good!  Wife had blueberry pancakes and loved them...she even let me have a bite!  The next time we visited I ordered the Club Sandwich and it was great!  Wife had the fried steak with two eggs special and cleaned her plate it was so good!  Can't wait to return to this wonderful downtown restaurant!

data.title: Delicious breakfast!
data.text: Recently visited my hometown of Kalamazoo to watch the boys junior national tennis tournament and stayed at the Radisson downtown.  Had breakfast at the Radisson (Burdick's for breakfast), Theo and Stacy's, and finally, The Studio Grill.  While The Studio Grill's interior is rather unassuming (quaint, small, or even sparse / no booths / tables only), the food is just really delicious!  Burdick's is a generic buffet and Theo and Stacy's is a decent diner, but there was definitely something special about The Studio Grill.  Even though I have only been there once, I had the distinct impression that they really care about the quality and preparation of the food.  The prices are also extremely reasonable.  I wish there was an identical restaurant in Malibu!

data.title: Breakfast perfection!
data.text: Stopped in for breakfast this past weekend and it was wonderful.  The staff was great, our meal was great  and the coffee was great.   My daughter and I shared the sausage Italian omelet and cinnamon roll pancakes.  My husband had the painter's sink omelet and pancakes. Everything was fresh and delicious.  Their cinnamon raisin bread toast was great topped with raspberry jam.  Our server never failed to refill our coffee despite how busy he was.  I highly recommend this place and we will be repeat customers.

data.title: Great Place for Breakfast.
data.text:
I was walking down the street looking for a place to have Breakfast.  I saw two big guys come out of the place and asked, "Good place for breakfast?"  They enthusiastically replied with an "Absolutely!"   I went in...

The décor is simple...the tables wear red plaid table cloths... the place is alive with the gentle conversation buzz of happy customers.

Food here is cooked the way you want it.  My eggs were done right.  The hash browns were cooked with flavor.  The bacon was crisp.

The whole staff moves!  Service is fast no matter how slammed they get.  My waitress was nice, friendly (and cute as a button).  

The place seems to get overrun by the locals-a good sign for any restaurant.

This is a great place for Breakfast although they serve lunch and dinner too.

data.title: AMAZING
data.text: this place is the best. I come here so often I have a frequent customer card! their cinnamon roll pancakes are TO DIE FOR and their burgers are stuffed with goodness and deliciousness. Try this place! they also sell local art and the owner always comes around to make sure your food tastes good :)

data.title: Stuffed Burgers Stuff your Soul
data.text: Do yourself a favor and go to Studio Grill for your first-half-of-the-day meals. The atmosphere is relaxed, yet busy during the typical rush times. The food is worth the wait. They've got a good thing going here, stuff your face with 100% edible love.

data.title: What a great breakfast place!
data.text: I overheard the waitress saying to another customer that all of their food is made from scratch. After eating one of their incredible omelettes, complete with gluten free toast (!) and homemade strawberry jam, I am a fan!! Their food tasted amazing and felt very nourishing. This is totally a find in downtown Kalamazoo and we'll be back there to try out their burgers on another day, given how good breakfast was! Friendly staff made us feel like we were in our hometown instead of just passing through. Well done Studio Grill!
